newsitem.title: ITALY: Bank of Italy seen buying marks at around 971 lire.
newsitem.headline: Bank of Italy seen buying marks at around 971 lire.

text.p: The Bank of Italy was buying marks for lire on Tuesday afternoon at around 971 lire, foreign exchange dealers said.
At 1415 GMT, the lire was quoted at 971.65/1.95 per mark after an earlier high at 970.70 and day's low of 972.90.
Dealers said that as on Monday the central bank intervention was aimed at braking the lira's appreciation against the German currency, avoiding exaggerated fluctuations on the crosses.
"If the Bank hadn't been in, the lira could have gone through 970," one dealer said.
Dealers said the firming dollar, which briefly rose above 1.80 marks, was pushing the lira towards the 970 level.
